WorkflowInfo.Name: Break Snapmirror
WorkflowInfo.Description: Break a Snapmirror relationship based on a given destination volume and vserver
WorkflowInfo.Details:
Information
This workflow breaks a Snapmirror relationship based on a given destination volume and Vserver. This workflow should be triggered by a Self Service request.

Requirements:
* NetApp module is configured and Up.

Input Variables (variables recieved from the Self Service request):
* NetApp Cluster
* Destination Svm
* Destination Volume

Output
Succees / Failure notice
WorkflowInfo.XML: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?><SequentialWorkflowActivity x:Name="CustomWorkflow" xmlns:ns0="clr-namespace:NetAppBreakSnapmirror;Assembly=NetAppBreakSnapmirror, Version=4.7.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" xmlns:ns1="clr-namespace:SelfServiceResponse;Assembly=SelfServiceResponse, Version=4.7.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=null" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/workflow" x:Class="WorkflowDesignerControl.CustomWorkflow"><ns0:NetAppBreakSnapmirror TypeName="NetAppBreakSnapmirror" HostId="-2" SelectedModuleType="23" HostName="%NetAppCluster%" SelectedModuleID="9" Username="" Password="" DisplayName="NetApp Break Snapmirror" RecoveryMethodSelection="{x:Null}" SelectedModuleName="NetApp" TimeInSeconds="0" Description="Breaks a SnapMirror relationship between a source and destination volume of a data protection mirror." IsValid="True" Timeout="00:01:00" x:Name="netAppBreakSnapmirror1" DestinationVserver="%DestinationSvm%" DestinationVolume="%DestinationVolume%" /><ns1:SelfServiceResponse x:Name="selfServiceResponse1" IsValid="True" DisplayName="SelfService Response" RecoveryMethodSelection="{x:Null}" Description="Send response to self service request" TypeName="SelfServiceResponse" TerminationReason="%netAppBreakSnapmirror1%" /></SequentialWorkflowActivity>
